feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Pimcore Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in name field of Custom Reports
entry.content:
Impact

This vulnerability has the potential to steal a user's cookie and gain unauthorized access to that user's account through the stolen cookie or redirect users to other malicious sites.

Patches

Update to version 10.5.21 or apply this patch manually: https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/c36ef54ce33f7b5e74b7b0ab9eabfed47c018fc7.patch

Workarounds

Apply patches manually: https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/c36ef54ce33f7b5e74b7b0ab9eabfed47c018fc7.patch

References

https://huntr.dev/bounties/1a5e6c65-2c5e-4617-9411-5b47a7e743a6/

References

  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/security/advisories/GHSA-m6m9-gr85-79vm
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2614
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/c36ef54ce33f7b5e74b7b0ab9eabfed47c018fc7
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/1a5e6c65-2c5e-4617-9411-5b47a7e743a6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6m9-gr85-79vm

entry.title: [ibexa/user] Ibexa User Settings are accessible on the front-end for anonymous user
entry.content:
Impact

This security advisory is about the user settings, which include things like preferred time zone and number of items per page in item listings. These could be accessed by the anonymous user. This impacted only the anonymous users themselves, and had no impact on logged in users. As such the impact is limited, even if custom user settings have been added, but please consider if this matters for your site. The fix ensures that only logged in users can access their user settings.

References

https://developers.ibexa.co/security-advisories/ibexa-sa-2023-002-user-settings-are-accessible-on-the-front-end-for-the-anonymous-user

References

  • https://github.com/ibexa/user/security/advisories/GHSA-r3fg-3r88-6x3f
  • https://github.com/ibexa/user/commit/77d1a0926d93ca85aa6faeea66bee55e0e067551
  • https://developers.ibexa.co/security-advisories/ibexa-sa-2023-002-user-settings-are-accessible-on-the-front-end-for-the-anonymous-user
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r3fg-3r88-6x3f

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] teampass vulnerable to code injection
entry.content:
In nilsteampassnet/teampass prior to 3.0.7, if two users have the same folder access, malicious users can create an item where its label field is vulnerable to HTML injection. When other users see that item, it may force them to redirect to the attacker's website or capture their data using a form. The issue is fixed in version 3.0.7.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2591
  • https://github.com/nilsteampassnet/teampass/commit/57a977c6323656e5dc06ab5c227e75c3465a1a4a
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/705f79f4-f5e3-41d7-82a5-f00441cd984b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-prj5-2g2p-x2mw

entry.title: [thorsten/phpmyfaq] phpMyFAQ Improper Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
phpMyFAQ prior to version 3.1.13 does not properly validate email addresses when updating user profiles. This vulnerability allows an attacker to manipulate their email address and change it to another email address that is already registered in the system, including email addresses belonging to other users such as the administrator. Once the attacker has control of the other user's email address, they can request to remove the user from the system, leading to a loss of data and access.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2429
  • https://github.com/thorsten/phpmyfaq/commit/07552f5577ff8b1e6f7cdefafcce9b2a744d3a24
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/20d3a0b3-2693-4bf1-b196-10741201a540
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r69v-q48g-3966

entry.title: [nilsteampassnet/teampass] Cross Site Scripting in nilsteampassnet/teampass
entry.content:
nilsteampassnet/teampass prior to version 3.0.7 is vulnerable to cross site scripting (XSS) from item names within a folder.

References

entry.title: [craftcms/cms] craftcms/cms vulnerable to cross site scripting in RSS feed widget
entry.content:
A malformed title in the feed widget of craftcms/cms can deliver an XSS payload. This has been resolved in this commit.

References

  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/security/advisories/GHSA-j4mx-98hw-6rv6
  • https://github.com/craftcms/cms/commit/52bd161614620edbab2d24d078ca9ebca2528442

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-31144
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j4mx-98hw-6rv6

entry.title: [azuracast/azuracast] AzuraCast missing brute force prevention
entry.content:
The request rate limiting feature on the login page of AzuraCast before version 0.18.3 can be bypassed, which could allow an attacker to brute force login credentials.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2531
  • https://github.com/azuracast/azuracast/commit/bdb23594ad3e0c47c8568ce028a7c244a406cf9d
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/20463eb2-0f9d-4ea3-a2c8-93f80e7aca02
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4m7v-wr6v-2mw5

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Stored cross site scripting on tags
entry.content:
Concrete CMS (previously concrete5) before 9.2 is vulnerable to Stored XSS on Tags on uploaded files.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28476
  • https://concretecms.com
  • https://www.concretecms.org/about/project-news/security/concrete-cms-security-advisory-2023-04-20
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2ggc-552c-rmqr

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle SQL Injection vulnerability
entry.content:
The vulnerability was found Moodle which exists due to insufficient sanitization of user-supplied data in external Wiki method for listing pages. A remote attacker can send a specially crafted request to the affected application and execute limited SQL commands within the application database.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30944
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2188606
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=446286
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-77187
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/5521d1d6e8bb8bebb76ad8154095f6b18ea26e7f
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7mmc-22g7-3xq2

entry.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle External Control of File Name or Path vulnerability
entry.content:
The vulnerability was found Moodle which exists because the application allows a user to control path of the older to create in TinyMCE loaders. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request and create arbitrary folders on the system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30943
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2188605
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=446285
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-77718
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/59d42e1ed23f916dcb47d53c745bef18a116d800
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-22gj-8qj2-fj46

entry.title: [francoisjacquet/rosariosis] RosarioSIS vulnerable to CSV Injection
entry.content:
RosarioSIS 10.8.4 is vulnerable to CSV injection via the Periods Module.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-29918
  • https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JAhJOlfKKD5Y5zEKo0_8a3A-nQ7Dz_GIMmlXmOvXV48/edit?usp=sharing
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f8hp-grmr-pp7j

entry.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Pimcore Path Traversal Vulnerability in AdminBundle/Controller/Reports/CustomReportController.php
entry.content:
Impact

The impact of this path traversal and arbitrary extension is limited (creation of arbitrary files and appending data to existing files) but when combined with the SQL Injection, the exported data RESTRICTED DIFFUSION 9 / 9 can be controlled and a webshell can be uploaded. Attackers can use that to execute arbitrary PHP code on the server with the permissions of the webserver.

Patches

Update to version 10.5.18 or apply this patch manually https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/7f788fa44bc18bc1c9182c25e26b770a1d30b62f.patch

Workarounds

Apply patch https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/7f788fa44bc18bc1c9182c25e26b770a1d30b62f.patch manually.

References

https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/pull/14498

References

  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/security/advisories/GHSA-g2mc-fqqc-hxg3
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/pull/14498
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/7f788fa44bc18bc1c9182c25e26b770a1d30b62f.patch
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-30855
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/f1d904094700b513c4756904fa2b1e19d08d890e.patch
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g2mc-fqqc-hxg3

entry.title: [thorsten/phpmyfaq] phpMyFAQ vulnerable to Stored Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
phpMyFAQ prior to version 3.1.13 has a stored cross site scripting vulnerability in name field in add question module. This allows an attacker to steal user cookies.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-2428
  • https://github.com/thorsten/phpmyfaq/commit/0a4980d870bac92df945f6d022726c4e3ed584ab
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/cee65b6d-b003-4e6a-9d14-89aa94bee43e
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8595-6653-96p2
